descr: "A formal computable definition of an operation (on the RESTful interface) or a named query (using the search interaction)."

fields.name: resourceType
fields.descr: "This is a OperationDefinition resource"

fields.name: url
fields.descr: "An absolute URI that is used to identify this operation definition when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance. This SHALL be a URL, SHOULD be globally unique, and SHOULD be an address at which this operation definition is (or will be) published. The URL SHOULD include the major version of the operation definition. For more information see [Technical and Business Versions](resource.html#versions)."

fields.name: version
fields.descr: "The identifier that is used to identify this version of the operation definition when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the operation definition author and is not expected to be globally unique. For example, it might be a timestamp (e.g. yyyymmdd) if a managed version is not available. There is also no expectation that versions can be placed in a lexicographical sequence."

fields.name: name
fields.descr: "A natural language name identifying the operation definition. This name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation."

fields.name: status
fields.descr: "The status of this operation definition. Enables tracking the life-cycle of the content."

fields.name: kind
fields.descr: "Whether this is an operation or a named query."

fields.name: experimental
fields.descr: "A boolean value to indicate that this operation definition is authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing), and is not intended to be used for genuine usage."

fields.name: date
fields.descr: "The date  (and optionally time) when the operation definition was published. The date must change if and when the business version changes and it must change if the status code changes. In addition, it should change when the substantive content of the operation definition changes."

fields.name: publisher
fields.descr: "The name of the individual or organization that published the operation definition."

fields.name: description
fields.descr: "A free text natural language description of the operation definition from a consumer's perspective."

fields.name: jurisdiction
fields.descr: "A legal or geographic region in which the operation definition is intended to be used."

fields.name: purpose
fields.descr: "Explaination of why this operation definition is needed and why it has been designed as it has."

fields.name: idempotent
fields.descr: "Operations that are idempotent (see [HTTP specification definition of idempotent](http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec9.html)) may be invoked by performing an HTTP GET operation instead of a POST."

fields.name: code
fields.descr: "The name used to invoke the operation."

fields.name: comment
fields.descr: "Additional information about how to use this operation or named query."

fields.name: resource
fields.descr: "The types on which this operation can be executed."

fields.name: system
fields.descr: "Indicates whether this operation or named query can be invoked at the system level (e.g. without needing to choose a resource type for the context)."

fields.name: type
fields.descr: "Indicates whether this operation or named query can be invoked at the resource type level for any given resource type level (e.g. without needing to choose a specific resource id for the context)."

fields.name: instance
fields.descr: "Indicates whether this operation can be invoked on a particular instance of one of the given types."

fields.name: contained
fields.descr:
"These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope."
 derived from DomainResource

fields.name: extension
fields.descr:
"May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension."
 derived from DomainResource

fields.name: modifierExtension
fields.descr:
"May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions."
 derived from DomainResource

fields.name: id
fields.descr:
"The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes."
 derived from Resource
 derived from DomainResource

fields.name: implicitRules
fields.descr:
"A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content."
 derived from Resource
 derived from DomainResource

fields.name: language
fields.descr:
"The base language in which the resource is written."
 derived from Resource
 derived from DomainResource
